title: No. 20 Capital Christian takes control of league race with rout of Dixon
text:
No. 20 Capital Christian takes control of league race with rout of Dixon 
Cougars hold Rams to eight yards in second half, improve to 7-0 
D’Marcus Ross leads prolific rushing attack with 79 yards on eight carries 
Unsportsmanlike conduct penalties hurt Dixon Capital Christian quarterback, Jacob Norville (8), runs for a touchdown in the first quarter as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' Tino Hutchins (15) runs with the ball in the first quarter, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' Julian Leslie (6) runs for a touchdown in the fourth quarter as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Members of the Dixon High School band head to the field, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee The Cougars warm up as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' Jack Haney (27) is grabbed by Dixon Rams Bryce Nakamura (10) and Max Gorham (44) in the first quarter, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Dixon Rams' D'lornn Mcmullen (30) gains some yardage, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Dixon Rams' quarterback, Ben Nefzger (9), throws a pass in the third quarter as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee A pass is incomplete to Dixon Rams' Cesar Lugo (1) in the third quarter, as the Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' D'marcus Ross (10) carries the ball as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Dixon Rams' Cameron Garlick (22) plows into the Cougars defense as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' Jacob Norville (8) throws a pass in the second quarter as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. The pass was caught by Capital Christian Cougars' Tino Hutchins (15) for a complete touchdown play. Steve German Special to the Bee Dixon Rams' D'lornn Mcmullen (30) attempts to stop Capital Christian Cougars' Tino Hutchins (15) in the second quarter as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Hutchins ran the ball for a touchdown. Steve German Special to the Bee Cougars players prepare in their locker room before the game, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee The Capital Christian Cougars prepare to return to the field at halftime, as the Dixon Rams host the Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Dixon Rams' Terry Bruce (62) heads out for warmups as the Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee The Dixon High School Rams have a final conference before the game, as the Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Capital Christian Cougars' Jeremy Gunter (7) practices passes before the game, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee Cougars players slap the locker room door frame for good luck as they return to the field from halftime, as the Dixon Rams host the Capital Christian Cougars on Friday, October 16, 2015. Steve German Special to the Bee 1 of 21 
By Mark Billingsley 
Bee Correspondent 
Both teams have been on a collision course for weeks, but it’s the Dixon Rams who will be in the body shop for at least a week while the Capital Christian Cougars drove back to Sacramento Friday night with nary a scratch after denting, scraping and bashing the Rams. 
With the 47-0 win, the 20th-ranked Cougars (7-0) take control of the Golden Empire League title chase while the Rams (6-2) are left looking for composure. 
A bevy of Rams’ unsportsmanlike conduct penalties put the Cougars in great field position and they took advantage of it on both sides of the ball. 
The defending GEL champion Capital Christian racked up 445 yards of total offense, with 344 of that coming on the ground by seven different rushers. Freshman running back D’Marcus Ross led the way with 79 yards on eight carries and a 12-yard touchdown run on the second play of the game. 
Cougars quarterback Jacob Norville finished with 101 yards and touchdown throws of 19 and 14 yards, both to Julian Leslie. Leslie also had a TD run of seven yards midway through the fourth quarter that hastened a running clock. 
“(Ross) is just unbelievable and he’s going to be a special kid,” Norville said. “And Leslie, wow, this is only his second game with us and he’s only just now jelling.” 
Leslie transferred from Oakmont High School and had to sit out the first five games of the season, Norville said. 
The Cougars’ defense held the Rams to eight yards in the second half and 113 yards total for the night, which happened to mark the Rams’ seniors last game at Finney Field. 
After losing to Woodland 20-0, the Rams had won sixth in a row. Both teams scored 69 points last week, but Dixon only played the first half as West Campus forfeited after trailing 69-6 and suffering several injuries to an already small roster. Capital Christian was coming off a 69-0 win against Lindhurst. 
“It’s a lot of fun to play in this offense with so many weapons,” Norville said. “We have a great game plan every week and no matter what the defense does we can counter.” 
The Cougars have outscored their last five opponents 276-40. 
Mark Billingsley is a Carmichael-based freelance writer: editorwriter@att.net or @editorwriter001. Related content
